conclusion: Determine the electrostatic force on point charge q between capacitor plates.
Capacitance C of a parallel-plate capacitor is defined as C = εA/d.
Electric field E between plates with charge Q is E = Q/(εA) or E = V/d.
Force F on charge q in electric field E is F = qE.
Substitute E = Q/(εA) into F = qE to get F = q(Q/(εA)).
Using E = V/d and V = Q/C, we have E = Q/(Cd).
Substitute E = Q/(Cd) into F = qE to get F = q(Q/(Cd)).
Final expression for force is F = qQ/(Cd).
